explanation:
get_rq_param_unquoted_copy_z — directly called by get_rq_uname to copy/unquote username text; its implementation must be checked for any use of memcmp on null-terminated strings (it also calls MHD_str_unquote). MHD_str_unquote — helper called from get_rq_param_unquoted_copy_z; may perform string comparisons or operations and so must be examined for memcmp usage on NUL-terminated strings. get_rq_extended_uname_copy_z — directly called for the EXTENDED uname case; its implementation may use memcmp (or call other helpers) when handling/validating percent-decoded or extended username data. MHD_str_pct_decode_strict_n_ — helper used by get_rq_extended_uname_copy_z to percent-decode a substring; must be inspected for memcmp use comparing decoded NUL-terminated strings. MHD_hex_to_bin — called in the USERHASH case to convert hex to binary; must be checked because it handles hex string input (NUL-terminated or length-delimited) and could (incorrectly) use memcmp on NUL-terminated strings. toxdigitvalue — low-level helper used by MHD_hex_to_bin; include because its implementation might influence how hex input is processed and whether comparisons of NUL-terminated strings occur. struct MHD_RqDAuth — definition is required to know the exact types of params->username and params->username_ext.value (whether they are NUL-terminated strings or length-delimited buffers), which is essential to determine if any memcmp usage would be comparing NUL-terminated strings. struct MHD_DigestAuthUsernameInfo — definition is required to know how username/userhash_hex/userhash_bin are represented (pointers, lengths) and whether code treats them as NUL-terminated strings; this determines whether any memcmp use in callees would be comparing NUL-terminated strings. enum MHD_DigestAuthUsernameType (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_*) — the enum/constants determine which code path runs (STANDARD, USERHASH, EXTENDED); needed to know which callees and string-handling logic to inspect for memcmp misuse.

Inspecting the implementations of the listed functions and the data-type definitions will allow a reviewer to determine whether any memcmp calls (direct or indirect) compare NUL-terminated strings in the execution paths used by get_rq_uname.
